When you select an object in the tracking station (or when you're watching your current object in map mode), there's the "i" button on the right, displaying current velocity, height and other info such as coordinates.

It really needs to show inclination. There are other orbital elements in the game, but they aren't nearly that important for what common player wants. Most often it's about launching something into Kerbin's orbit. Instead of wild guess, or using MÃƒÂ¼n targeting, there should be a visible number. Plain and simple.

In case anyone wants to play with those elements in real time, here's a nice little Android application.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.fiveforfiveapps.orbitdesigner
